title: Current-carrying wires - force in B-field at angle

content.prompt: A current-carrying wire is initially placed perpendicular to a magnetic field directed out of the page, as shown in Figure 1. The wire is then rotated so that it is parallel to the field with the current directed into the page, as shown in Figure 2. Which of the following correctly describes the change to the magnetic force exerted on the wire from Figure 1 to Figure 2 and provides correct justification?

choices.label: The force decreases because the wire will not experience a force if the current is parallel to the field.
The force decreases because the magnetic field created by the wire in Figure 2 cancels the magnetic field around the wire.
The force increases because the wire will not experience a force if it is perpendicular to the field.
The force increases because the wire will experience a greater force with the current and field in opposite directions.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
